{"text":"WEBSITE-CREATION PROMPT (Explorerâ€™s Journal of Science â€“ EJS)

You are a senior full-stack web developer and UX/product designer building a modern, high-credibility academic journal website.

Journal Overview

Name: The Explorerâ€™s Journal of Science (EJS)
Type: Independent, student-led, faculty-mentored, international research journal
Fields: Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics (STEM)
Audience:

Primary: Gen Z (13â€“25) student researchers

Secondary: Gen Alpha (early teens, discovery-focused)

Tertiary: Faculty advisors, reviewers, institutions

Tone: Professional, credible, minimal â€” but friendly, non-intimidating, and visual-first
(Credible like Nature, accessible like Notion, engaging like a modern startup)

Core Goals

Establish academic legitimacy

Make submission & peer review crystal clear

Highlight faculty advisory board

Encourage global student participation

Experience Principles

No academic gatekeeping

Simple English, scannable sections

Clear â€œwhatâ€™s in it for meâ€

Visual explanations over long text

Mobile-first, confidence-building UX

Pages to Build
1. Home (Scroll-Based)

Hero with mission: â€œExploration begins with curiosityâ€

Subtext: Research, made accessible

CTAs:

ðŸš€ Submit Your Research

ðŸ§  How Peer Review Works

ðŸ¤ Join the Team

3-step visual flow: Submit â†’ Review â†’ Publish

Featured articles (card layout)

Social proof (advisors / institutions)

Metrics placeholders (reach, acceptance rate)

2. About EJS

Use this content (editable, web-ready):

About Us
The Explorerâ€™s Journal of Science (EJS) is an independent, student-led research journal built for curious minds. We exist to make scientific exploration accessible, exciting, and meaningful for students worldwide.
Founded on the belief that research isnâ€™t just for professionals, EJS provides a platform for students, educators, and early researchers to share ideas, experiments, and discoveries across STEM.
At EJS, science begins with curiosity. Every question matters. Every experiment counts.

Mission
To ignite scientific curiosity, promote research-driven learning, and provide an open platform for students to publish, collaborate, and engage with real scientific inquiry.

Vision
To build a global community of young scientists who believe in questioning, exploring, and sharing knowledge.

3. Editorial & Faculty Board

Card-based layout

Name, role, institution, short bio

Faculty Advisory Board shown separately with high-prestige design

4. Submit Your Paper

Clear guidelines

Accepted formats: PDF, Word, LaTeX

Review timeline

Plagiarism & ethics policy

Submission form or external link

FAQ: â€œIs my research good enough?â€

5. Review Process

Visual explanation of double-blind peer review

Step-by-step workflow

Ethical standards explained simply

6. Publications

Volume â†’ Issue â†’ Paper structure

Paper cards: title, authors, abstract toggle, PDF

DOI-style identifiers (placeholder)

Share & download buttons

7. Join Us

Roles: Reviewer, Editor, Tech, Outreach

Skills-based, not credential-based

â€œWhat youâ€™ll learnâ€ focus

Simple apply forms

8. Contact

Friendly copy

Forms + email

Use these links:

Queries/Collabs: https://forms.gle/LhKn1gGqqgct4LhR6

Submissions: https://forms.gle/jN5hwF7EQjNkr4mM7

Email: ejs.sciencejournalteam@gmail.com

Design System

Off-white background

Accent: deep blue / charcoal / muted purple

Fonts: Inter / Space Grotesk (+ optional serif)

Subtle animations, hover effects

Dark mode support

WCAG accessible

Tech Stack

Next.js (App Router)

React

Tailwind CSS

Framer Motion

SEO optimized, fast load

Output Requirement

Production-ready, scalable website where a 14-year-old feels confident submitting, and a professor feels proud to be listed."}

{"text":"I'll create a modern, credible academic journal website for EJS that balances professionalism with accessibility. This will be a multi-page React application with smooth navigation, animations, and a cohesive design system.\n\nLet me start by setting up the design system and core structure:","textMode":"visible_message"}

{"text":"This is a comprehensive request to build a full academic journal website. Let me analyze the requirements:

1. **Classification**: This is clearly **PureFrontend** - it's a static website with forms linking to external Google Forms. No database or backend is explicitly required.

2. **Pages needed**:
   - Home (scroll-based landing)
   - About EJS
   - Editorial & Faculty Board
   - Submit Your Paper
   - Review Process
   - Publications
   - Join Us
   - Contact

3. **Design requirements**:
   - Modern, credible, accessible
   - Mobile-first
   - Dark mode support
   - Off-white background with deep blue/charcoal/muted purple accents
   - Inter/Space Grotesk fonts
   - Framer Motion animations
   - WCAG accessible

4. **Tech Stack**:
   - React (we're using React)
   - Tailwind CSS (available)
   - Motion (Framer Motion - available as motion/react)
   - Next.js style routing (we can simulate with client-side routing or hash routing)

Let me build this as a comprehensive multi-page React application with proper routing, components, and styling.

I'll need to:
1. Set up routing (using hash routing or state-based navigation)
2. Create a design system in globals.css
3. Build all the page components
4. Create reusable components (cards, buttons, etc.)
5. Add animations with Motion
6. Ensure mobile responsiveness
7. Use Unsplash for images

Let me start by creating the structure and then building out each page.","signature":""}

\\n
\\n {/* Logo */}\\n handleNavigate('home')}\\n className=\\\"flex items-center space-x-3 group\\\"\\n >\\n

\\n

Explorer's Journal

of Science

\\n {navItems.map((item) => (\\n handleNavigate(item.page)}\\n className={`px-3 py-2 rounded-lg transition-colors ${\\n currentPage === item.page\\n ? 'bg-primary/10 text-primary'\\n : 'text-foreground/70 hover:bg-muted hover:text-foreground'\\n }`}\\n >\\n {item.name}\\n \\n ))}\\n
\\n\\n {/* Right side actions */}\\n
\\n setIsDark(!isDark)}\\n className=\\\"p-2 rounded-lg hover:bg-muted transition-colors\\\"\\n aria-label=\\\"Toggle dark mode\\\"\\n >\\n {isDark ? : }\\n \\n\\n {/* Mobile menu button */}\\n setIsOpen(!isOpen)}\\n className=\\\"lg:hidden p-2 rounded-lg hover:bg-muted transition-colors\\\"\\n aria-label=\\\"Toggle menu\\\"\\n >\\n {isOpen ? : }\\n \\n

{"text":"I'll help you build a comprehensive newsletter authentication system with a powerful Master Admin panel for EJS. This requires backend functionality for authentication, secure data storage, and email capabilities.

Since this feature requires:
- **User authentication** (email/OTP verification)
- **Secure database** for subscriber storage
- **Backend API** for newsletter management
- **Email sending** capabilities
- **Role-based access control**

**Supabase is essential for your specific request** because it provides:
- Built-in authentication with email/OTP
- PostgreSQL database for subscribers
- Row-level security for data protection
- Real-time capabilities for the admin dashboard
- Secure backend without exposing credentials

**Important Note**: Figma Make is designed for frontend prototypes and is not meant for collecting real Personally Identifiable Information (PII) like names and emails, or securing sensitive data. For production use with real subscribers, you'll need to deploy this to a secure hosting environment.

Let me connect you to Supabase to build this system properly:","textMode":"visible_message"}
